events.description: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and US envoy Steve Witkoff are scheduled to discuss nuclear issues and sanctions relief.
The Energy Information Administration reported a decrease in US crude inventories.
The US-flagged tanker Stena Imperative was harassed by small armed vessels.

facts.fact_text: WTI crude oil futures rose to approximately $63.5 per barrel on Wednesday.

evidences.evidence_text: WTI crude oil futures rose to around $63.5 per barrel on Wednesday

facts.fact_text: US crude inventories decreased by 3.5 million barrels last week according to the EIA.

evidences.evidence_text: US crude inventories fell by 3.5 million barrels last week, according to the Energy Information Administration

facts.fact_text: The API estimated a crude inventory decline of 11.1 million barrels.

evidences.evidence_text: less than the 11.1 million barrel decline estimated by the API on Tuesday

facts.fact_text: The Middle East region supplies approximately one-third of global crude oil.

evidences.evidence_text: a region supplying roughly a third of global crude

claims.claim_text: Market price movements are being driven by a balance between geopolitical tensions and inventory data.

evidences.evidence_text: markets balanced geopolitical tensions in the Middle East against a drop in US stockpiles

claims.claim_text: There are increased fears of conflict within the Middle East region.

evidences.evidence_text: amid heightened fears of conflict in a region supplying roughly a third of global crude

evidence.evidence_text: markets balanced geopolitical tensions in the Middle East against a drop in US stockpiles
US crude inventories fell by 3.5 million barrels last week
heightened fears of conflict in a region supplying roughly a third of global crude
